channel.title: Coordinates!
channel.description: How do I get coordinates of my current possition or even enter in a command that will let me do so?

item.title: Coordinates!
item.dc:creator: @Da_Vinci Da Vinci
item.description:
@Da_Vinci wrote:

[quote=“VbCoder, post:7, topic:352888”][quote author=supernovarsps link=topic=449203.msg3295677#msg3295677 date=1280927892]
Note: some objects cant be deleted im not pro coder either like i said before but its probly part of the graphics so cant be removed.
[/quote]
I lol’d…

@Ein…
Isn’t there a void called something like ‘deleteobjects’ or something in your client.java?[/quote]

Yep, it’s called public void Deleteobjects and looks like this:

public void Deleteobjects() { deletethatobject(XXXX, YYYY); deletethatobject(XXXX, YYYY);

XXXX - X coordinates of the object
YYYY - Y coordinates of the object

Hope I helped!
~Leo.

Read full topic

item.title: Coordinates!
item.dc:creator: @supernovarsps supernovarsps
item.description:
@supernovarsps wrote:

im a begginer at coding sorta so this what id go stand by the chair (on the south of it but standing beside it) do ::mypos and then on the second list of numbers it will be like something like this(2345) (5678) and then id do ::teleto 2345 5679 and then ill be on chair do ::mypos. Then id go to my source folder and search for those cords on my search bar threw all the files and if i get a file ill go to it and then do Ctrl+f type one of the numbers and find the cordinates and if i do find it ill backspace the object with the item.

Note: some objects cant be deleted im not pro coder either like i said before but its probly part of the graphics so cant be removed.

Note: you can put a npc or another object over it to cover it up =]

Read full topic
